subject: Communication
title: Nonviolent Communication (NVC)
description: Learn Nonviolent Communication (NVC) in one minute.

hook.text: Marshall Rosenberg walked into a room of warring factions in the Middle East armed with one framework. No weapons.

buildup.text: NVC has four steps: observe without evaluating, state feelings, identify needs, and make a clear request.

discovery.text: 'You never listen' becomes 'When I see you on your phone during our talks, I feel hurt because I need connection.

twist.text: NVC sounds mechanical at first. But it works because it replaces blame language with ownership language.

climax.text: Rosenberg used NVC in prisons, war zones, and schools. The framework scales from personal arguments to international.

punchline.text: Violence starts with language. So does peace.

quiz.question: What are the four steps of Nonviolent Communication?
